metadata.title: CVE-2012-5120 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Google V8 before 3.13.7.5, as used in Google Chrome before 23.0.1271.64, on64-bit Linux platforms allows remote attackers to cause a denial of serviceor possibly have unspecified other impact via crafted JavaScript code thattriggers an out-of-bounds access to an array.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-5120` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 24.0.1312.56-0ubuntu1
chromium-browser-l10n - 24.0.1312.56-0ubuntu1
chromium-chromedriver - 24.0.1312.56-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 24.0.1312.56-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 24.0.1312.56-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '24.0.1312.56-0ubuntu1').
